original: Broman, Yngve Wilhedm, förste stadsläkare, Lysekil, f. 6/4/99 i Norsjö, Västerb. 1., av apot. Hjalmar B. o. Lydia Fredrika Skog. G. 32 m. Lisa Xandra Kerstin Gunnelius. Barn: Anita Margareta f. 34, Karin Lilli Birgitta 36. — Stud:ex. i Nyköp. 17, med. kand. i Upps. 21, med. lic. i Sthlm 26. Assist :läk. v. Nyköp. las. 22-23, v. Torsby las. 26, tf. las :läk. i Oskarshamn kort. tider 26 o. 27, tf. prov:-läk. i Odensbackens distr. 26-27, tf. sjukst :läk. i Lenhovda 27, tf. prov.läk. i Tanumshede distr. 27-28, ett flert. kort. förordn. s. las :läk. 26-28, assist, v. Seraf:las. öronpoliklin. 28, e. läk. v. Torsby las. 29-30, andre und :läk. v. Eskilstuna las. 31, förste und :läk. v. kir. avd. där 31-32, därunder tf. över-läk. tre mån., läk. v. epid:sjukst. o. sjukst. i Lysekil fr. 32, tf. andre stads-läk. där 35 o. nu förste stadsläk.
translated: Broman, Yngve Wilhedm, first city physician, Lysekil, b. 6/4/99 in Norsjö, Västerbotten county, son of pharmacist Hjalmar B. and Lydia Fredrika Skog. Married in 1932 to Lisa Xandra Kerstin Gunnelius, with two children: Anita Margareta, b. 1934 and Karin Lilli Birgitta, b. 1936. He passed his studentexamen in Nyköping in 1917, received his Bachelor of Medicine degree in Uppsala in 1921, and his medical license in Stockholm in 1926. He worked as a assistant physician at the Nyköping hospital from 1922-1923, at the Torsby hospital in 1926, and as a temporary hospital physician in Oskarshamn for short periods in 1926 and 1927. He was also a temporary physician in the Odensbacken district in 1926-1927, a temporary hospital physician in Lenhovda in 1927, and a temporary district physician in Tanumshede in 1927-1928. He held several short-term appointments as a hospital physician from 1926-1928, served as a assistant physician at the Serafimerlasarettet Ear Clinic in 1928, medical doctor at the Torsby hospital from 1929-1930, second assistant physician at the Eskilstuna hospital in 1931 and first assistant physician at the surgical department there from 1931-1932, during which he was acting chief physician for three months. From 1932 he worked as a physician at the Lysekil epidemic hospital and general hospital, and since 1935 he has been second city physician of Lysekil, and currently serves as the first city physician.
